content: Fixed Deposits Bank Account CIMB DBS Multiplier Savings Asked by AnonymousAsked on 27 Jul 2019What's the best place to keep $35k for 6 months and earn some interest?I have about 35k which I need to hold on to for about 6 months, and I thought I could at least earn a bit of interest on it for a while. I would prefer to separate this amount from my own DBS Multiplier account. Which would be my best option? CIMB or some fixed deposit?3 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Elijah Lee, Independent Financial Advisor at Phillip Securities (Jurong East Lite)Top Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 27 Jul 2019CIMB currently offers the highest no strings attached savings account at 1%. However if you are very certain that you will have no need for the money before 6 months, consider a fixed deposit. CIMB rates for FDs are also competitive.0 comments6

Clarence Chua, Financial Planning Specialist at Prudential Assurance SingaporeTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterAnswered on 27 Jul 2019Most fixed deposit is longer than 6 months as far as I know.It may be best to put them into a high yield savings account such as your multiplier account. You can put them in CIMB too, the returns in absolute dollars will be marginal since its 6 months only.0 comments4
峻豪Level 2. RookieAnswered on 30 Jul 2019If you need to take some out, then consider CIMB FastSaver, if not you can consider fixed deposit like CIMB 1.7% or Sing Finance 1.8%0 comments0
